title: Laws Local Extent Act, 1874
description: Official consolidated text of Laws Local Extent Act, 1874 (XV of 1874) published by The Pakistan Code (General Laws).

provisions.title: Section 2. Interpretation
provisions.content:
clause. In this Act the expression “Scheduled Districts” means the
territories mentioned in the sixth schedule hereto annexed.

provisions.title: Section 3. Local extent of Acts in first schedule. The Acts mentioned in the first schedule hereto
provisions.content: annexed are now in force throughout 3[Pakistan], except the Scheduled Districts.

provisions.title: Section 6. [Local extent of enactments in fourth schedule.] Omitted by the Federal Laws (Revision
provisions.content: and Declaration) Ordinance, 1981 (XXVII of 1981), s. 3 and IInd Sch.

provisions.title: Section 8. Savings. Nothing herein contained shall
provisions.content:
_
(a)        bar the power of the 5[Federal Government] or the 6[Provincial Government],
under any law for the time being in force, to extend to any place any Act men-
tioned in the said first schedule;
(b)        extend any Act empowering the 6[Provincial Government] to extend the same
or any part thereof, or affect in any manner the exercise of such power;
(c)        affect the operation of any Act or Regulation heretofore extended to or
declared to be in force in any of the Scheduled Districts;
1
For the Statement of Objects and Reasons, see Gazette of India, 1870 Pt. V., p. 153; and for Proceedings in Council, see ibid., 1871, Supplement pp.
1074 and 1218; and ibid., 1874 Supplement, pp. 1885 and 1976.
This Act has been extended and shall be deemed to have been so extended to the whole of Pakistan by the Central Laws (Statute Reform) Ordinance
1960 (21 of 1960), s. 3 and 2nd Sch. (with effect from the 14th October, 1955)
2
The words “in the Presidencies of Fort St. George and Bombay, and in the Lower and the North-Western Provinces of the Presidency of Fort William
in Bengal” omitted by A. O., 1949, Sch.
3
Subs. by the Central Laws (Statute Reform) Ordinance, 1960 (21 of 1960), s. 3 and 2nd Sch. (with effect from the 14th October, 1955) for “all the
Provinces and the Capital of the Federation” which had been subs. by A. O., 1949, Arts 3 (2) and 4, for the whole of British India”.
4
This section was previously amended by Ord. 21 of 1960. s. 3 and 2nd Sch. and A.O., 1961, Art. 2 (w.e.f. 23-3-1956).
5
Subs. by F.A.O., 1975, Art. 2 and Table, for “Central Government” which was subs. by A.O., 1937, for “G, G. in C.”,
6
Subs. ibid., for “L. G.”
(d)        revive any enactment which has been repealed either generally or with
reference to some special subject;
1

(k)        affect the operation of any enactment not mentioned in any of the schedules
hereto annexed.
